abstract: As anger over bonuses paid to the executives of failing companies grows, the Supreme Court will hear a case this fall that may turn out to be the court’s first significant statement on the corporate culture that helped lead to the Great Recession.
snippet: As anger over bonuses paid to the executives of failing companies grows, the Supreme Court will hear a case this fall that may turn out to be the court’s first significant statement on the corporate culture that helped lead to the Great Recession.
lead_paragraph: As anger over huge bonuses paid to the executives of failing companies continues to grow, the Supreme Court will hear a case this fall, Jones v. Harris Associates, that may turn out to be the court’s first significant statement on the corporate culture that helped lead to the Great Recession, The New York Times’s Adam Liptak wrote.

headline.main: Supreme Court to Hear Case on Executive Pay
